translated: Stories of Departed Ones🔽The Shorter Collection
. The Story of the Young Man Departed
The Sugata’s knowledge is of the form of a measure,
The Teacher declared it according to the person;

analyzed: ussanna puññāḥ api bhavanti ha ike
translated: Some have abundant merit,

analyzed: paritta puññā api bhavanti ha ike
translated: Some have little merit.
This young man was abandoned in the charnel ground,
He lives on the fat of his thumb at night;

original: Na yakkhabhūtā na sarīsapā vā,🔽Viheṭhayeyyuṁ katapuññaṁ kumāraṁ.
analyzed: na yakkha bhūtāḥ na sarīsapāḥ vā  viheṭhayeyyum kata puññam kumāra
translated: Neither spirits, nor snakes, nor beasts of prey,🔽Would harm the young man who has made merit.

original: Sunakhāpimassa palihiṁsu pāde,🔽Dhaṅkā siṅgālā parivattayanti;🔽Gabbhāsayaṁ pakkhigaṇā haranti,
analyzed: pāde  dhaṅkā siṅgālā parivattayanti  gabbhā sayam pakkhi gaṇāḥ haranti
translated: Even dogs licked his feet,🔽Jackals and hyenas turned him over;🔽Flocks of birds carried off his entrails,
But crows took away the fat from his eyes.

original: Nayimassa rakkhaṁ vidahiṁsu keci,🔽Na osadhaṁ sāsapadhūpanaṁ vā;
analyzed: rakkham vidahisu keci  na osadham sāsapa dhūpanam vā
translated: No one made a protection for him,🔽No medicine, no asafoetida smoke;
They did not even take up an astrological combination,
They did not even scatter all the grains.
Such a one, who has attained the highest state,
Was abandoned in the charnel ground, fed at night;
Like a lump of food, being digested,
With a remainder of life that is doubtful.
The One Worshipped by Gods and Humans saw him,
Having seen him, the one of great wisdom declared:
“This prince will be the foremost of the city’s citizens,
In terms of wealth and family.”
“What is the purpose of this, what is the spiritual life for?
What is the result of well-practiced (spiritual life),
Having reached such a disaster,

analyzed: tam tādisam  buddha pamukhassa bhikkhu saṅghassa
translated: You will experience such success.”
The people made a great offering to the Sangha of monks headed by the Buddha;
There was a change in the mind of one of them,

original: Vācaṁ abhāsi pharusaṁ asabbhaṁ.🔽So taṁ vitakkaṁ pavinodayitvā,
analyzed: vācam abhāsi pharusam asabbha  saḥ tam vitakkam pavi nodayitvā
translated: And he spoke harsh, unbeneficial words.🔽Having removed that thought,

original: Pītiṁ pasādaṁ paṭiladdhā pacchā;🔽Tathāgataṁ jetavane vasantaṁ,
analyzed: pītim pasādam paṭiladdhā pacchā  tathāgatam jetavane vasanta
translated: And having attained joy and confidence afterwards,🔽The Realised One, while residing in Jeta’s Wood,

original: Yāguyā upaṭṭhāsi sattarattaṁ.🔽Tassa vataṁ taṁ pana brahmacariyaṁ,
analyzed: yāguyā upaṭṭhāsi sattaratta  tassa vatam tam pana
translated: He served rice-gruel for seven nights.🔽That was his spiritual life,
That is the result of well-practiced (spiritual life),
Having reached such a disaster,
He experienced such success.

original: Ṭhatvāna so vassasataṁ idheva,🔽Sabbehi kāmehi samaṅgibhūto;
analyzed: saḥ vassa satam idhā iva  sabbehi kāmehi samaṅgi bhūtaḥ
translated: Having lived here for a hundred years,🔽Endowed with all the pleasures,
After the break up of the body, in the next world,
he goes to the companionship of Vāsava.
The Story of the Young Man Petas is the fifth.
